1123953773771145217.text:
Today we also published a list of free learning project ideas that we think should exist:

 http://freelearners.org/build-the-future …

Like ClassPass for auditing university classes, Pioneer for learners, GitHub for academic research, LegalZoom for starting charter schools, etc.

1123953284191072257.text:
I really like the startups building communities of learners who support and encourage each other’s learning.

We’ve been calling this edu category free learning, because it’s like free diving or free climbing, but for free-form adventures in learning. 

 http://usv.com/blog/free-learning …

1100774830205480960.text:
I used to think distributed compute was about  price but now I get it's about  integrity.

The thought is that while distributed compute can catch up to centralized on usability, centralized can never catch up to distributed on integrity.

 blog: http://usv.com/blog/the-distributed-computing-update-3 …pic.twitter.com/OkK0c9pMij

1064537327702298624.text:
There's a big opportunity to reinvent the syllabus for the web. 

 It would overlay other talks and papers like a map for self-learning. 

 “First read X, think about Y. Now read Z, think how it relates to X”. 

 On our quest to find Syllabus 2.0: https://usv.com/blog/looking-for-syllabus-20 …

1046772297166716929.text:
There's an idea in crypto that we need tools before we can build apps. But usually, apps come first and inspire us to build tools. Not the other way around.

 lightbulbs => the grid
 planes => airports
 sites => javascript

@nickgrossman & I wrote: http://usv.com/blog/the-myth-of-the-infrastructure-phase …

1026845040092561409.text:
One of the applications of cryptocurrency I'm still most excited about is distributed compute. Here's what we're seeing happen in this space: https://www.usv.com/blog/the-distributed-computing-update … 

The big open questions are: shared vs isolated networks, layer 1 vs layer 2 compute, and 1 token model vs 2.
